title: Bunny O' Justice - Single Specialty Bunny

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a single Specialty Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Specialty Bunnies
rules.text: Specialty Bunnies have no color (Blue, Green, Orange, Violet, or Yellow) or kind (Congenial, Gleeful, Lumbering, Sinister, or Timid). Specialty bunnies are their own kind of bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a single Specialty Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Specialty Bunnies
rules.text: Specialty Bunnies have no color (Blue, Green, Orange, Violet, or Yellow) or kind (Congenial, Gleeful, Lumbering, Sinister, or Timid). Specialty bunnies are their own kind of bunny.

title: Ye Royal Bunnies - Double Specialty Bunny

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a double Specialty Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Specialty Bunnies
rules.text: Specialty Bunnies have no color (Blue, Green, Orange, Violet, or Yellow) or kind (Congenial, Gleeful, Lumbering, Sinister, or Timid). Specialty bunnies are their own kind of bunny.

title: The Greatest American Bunny - Double Specialty Bunny

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a double Specialty Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Specialty Bunnies
rules.text: Specialty Bunnies have no color (Blue, Green, Orange, Violet, or Yellow) or kind (Congenial, Gleeful, Lumbering, Sinister, or Timid). Specialty bunnies are their own kind of bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a triple Specialty Bunny. Players with this bunny in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Specialty Bunnies
rules.text: Specialty Bunnies have no color (Blue, Green, Orange, Violet, or Yellow) or kind (Congenial, Gleeful, Lumbering, Sinister, or Timid). Specialty bunnies are their own kind of bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose a Carrot from Kaballa's Market. When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose two Carrots from Kaballa's Market. When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose two Carrots from Kaballa's Market. When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must feed the amounts shown by the end of its next turn or die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be given to any opponent whose bunnies must each feed the amounts show above by the end of his next turn or die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be given to all opponents with a bunny. Each must feed any one bunny the amounts shown by the end of their next turns their bunny dies.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 2 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 4 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 6 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 8 to survive.

rules.title: Containment Suit
rules.text: The Containment Suit will protect a bunny against Curry Spiced Poppadoms.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 10 to survive. Adjacent bunnies must roll higher than 9 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which dies immediately. All bunnies within four spaces are also killed. Clover bunnies may survive.

rules.title: Holographic Bunny
rules.text: Anti-Matter Raisins is one of the few weapons that can kill the Holographic Bunny

rules.title: Albino Baby 5000
rules.text: The Albino Baby 5000 can be used to protect bunnies from Anti-Matter Raisins.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed between any two players and stops weapons that affect adjacent bunnies. Barrier reverses the direction of Roaming Red Run cards.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
Barrier may be placed between any two players and stops weapons that affect adjacent bunnies. For example, the effects of a Nuclear Warhead may not reach your bunny if there is a Barrier between it and the target bunny in The Bunny Circle.

Barrier reverses the direction of Roaming Red Run cards (such as Cyber Bunny or Cruise Missile Prime). Barrier will cause any Roaming Red Run card to move in the opposite direction after it is reversed. Barrier does not stop any multi-target, non-Roaming Red Run card circumstances. More than one Barrier may be placed side by side between the same two players.

rules.title: Cards which remove Barriers
rules.text: A Barrier may be eliminated by the Europan Robotic Titanium Termites or the Magic Spatula.

rules.title: Cards which are unaffected by Barriers
rules.text:
Barrier does not stop any multi-target, non-Roaming Red Run card circumstances. This includes:
  • Army of the 12 Bunnies
  • Boomerang
  • Clumsy Congenial
  • Electron Tunneling
  • F-18 Hornet (even though it is a Roaming Red Run card)
  • Psychic Waves
  • Pumpkin Ridge
  • Snowball

rules.title: Cards that Barrier eliminates
rules.text: A Barrier placed between bunnies joined by the Fingercuffs separates those bunnies and the Fingercuffs are discarded.

rules.title: Electron Tunneling
rules.text: Electron Tunneling can be used to allow a ranged weapon to penetrate a barrier.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny and changes its color to Red. Bunnies that become Red will inherit the special feature for that type of bunny.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Bunny Booster may be placed under single color (or half color) Congenial, Gleeful, Lumbering, Sinister and Timid bunnies (but not Super bunnies).

rules.title: Red Bunny Benefits
rules.text:
• Red Congenial - This bunny may feed up to 3 Cabbage Units and 3 Water Units per turn. Supplies may not be saved to another turn. The Cabbage and Water units are for the exclusive use of this bunny and may not be shared with other bunnies in The Bunny Circle.
  • Red Gleeful - The player with this bunny in The Bunny Circle may spend 3 Dolla per turn at any open store. Dolla may not be saved to another turn.
  • Red Lumbering - This bunny has a Lucky Clover Triple which lowers the level of any weapon used against this bunny by three.
  • Red Sinister - This bunny is protected by a Bounce Back Force Field. Any weapon that directly targets this bunny, but is not successful, is placed back onto one of the bunnies of the attacking player.
  • Red Timid - The player with this bunny in The Bunny Circle may re-roll any action during play that involves any die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to force any opponent to exchange two of his bunnies for one of yours.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: In order to use this card against an opponent, that player must have at least two bunnies. Bunny Exchange cannot be used for a one to one exchange. The player chooses all three bunnies in the exchange. A bunny with The Heavenly Halo may be taken with the Bunny Exchange card.

rules.title: Bad Mood Ood
rules.text: Bad Mood Ood may be used to eliminate this card.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to eliminate any one Barrier. Cannot be used to eliminate a Neutronium Barrier.

rules.title: Hitchbunny's Guide
rules.text: Hitchbunny's Guide can be used to retrieve this card from the discard pile because it contains a picture of the planet Jupiter

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to immediately view the top five cards of the small Carrot Card deck.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to take the Carrot with the same number rolled on the Clear die from either Kaballa's Market or an opponent. If a player owned the carrot then he must return all of his other Carrots back to Kaballa's Market (even if the market is closed).

rules.title: The Magic Spatula
rules.text: The Magic Spatula can be used to eliminate Low Jack Kojak.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny. Hexdruple Lucky Clover lowers the level of any weapon by five.

rules.title: Cards which remove Clover
rules.text: The Black Cat can be used to remove Clover cards from a bunny. Bunnies abducted by Area 51 or the Mothership must also discard all Clover.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
Reopens the Store. New prices:
5 Dolla - for each Defense Card
Level - for each Weapon card
(Weapons must be run through.)

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player with no Dolla to take half from the opponent with the most.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
If two opponents have an equal amount of Dolla, then the player may choose which opponent must Share The Wealth.
If the opponent with the most Dolla has an odd amount that cannot be divided equally, then he will keep the extra Dolla for himself.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to either force The Trojan Bunny to explode immediately or to revive one bunny from the Discard Pile for every two of his in The Bunny Circle of the same color.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: A player may revive any bunny from the Discard Pile (including Free Agent, Holographic, Specialty and Celebrity bunnies) regardless of the color of the bunnies used to revive it.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to force any two adjacent players to exchange their Bottom and Top Run cards.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The Bottom and Top Run cards of the first player become the Bottom and Top Run cards of the second player and vice versa.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to replace all or some of his seven cards with new cards from the Draw Pile. These may include the Bottom and Top Run cards.

rules.title: Mysterious Place
rules.text: The player who currently holds the Yellow Ball can control the destiny of this card. The opponent must play the card first, then the player holding the Yellow Ball may redirect it to any other player, bunny or the Discard Pile.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Allows a player to eliminate the Triple Or Trouble or to counteract Bankrupcy before losing all of his Dolla. This card must be a saved Special to be used immediately.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to double the amount of Water Units on any pending Feed The Bunny card.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to feed the bunny. One bunny is fed any amounts of Cabbage Units and Water Units.

rules.title: P-Cards
rules.text: P-Cards may be used twice by a player (with the matching color Pawn) in the same turn, or during two different turns. After a P-Card has been used, place the colored Pawn on top of the card to indicate that it has been used once. After a P-Card has been used twice, discard the card (but save the Pawn, of course).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny or Pawn which becomes the same color as the highest die rolled. If placed on a bunny and Black is the highest die rolled then the bunny dies. Bunnies that become Red or Pink will inherit the special feature for that type of bunny.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Random Paintball Assault may not be placed under Specialty bunnies or Celebrity bunnies

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to force any opponent to discard his Bottom and Top Run cards and to replace them with new cards.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The opponent may take new cards from the Draw Pile before replacing his Bottom and Top Run cards.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to transform any Run card into a Special card which may then be played immediately from his five-card hand.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
May be used once by a player against any weapon.
3 Odd rolls = The weapon is redirected.
2 Odd rolls = The weapon is eliminated.
1 Odd roll = Lame rodd. Nothing changes!
0 Odd rolls = Disaster! The weapon hits the target bunny with double strength and double range.
May be used at any time!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
If the weapon is a single target weapon, then double range means that it will affect adjacent bunnies in The Bunny Circle as well.

If the current date (day, month and year) consists of three Odd numbers, then the player may automatically redirect the weapon without having to roll the dice. If the current date (day, month and year) consists of no Odd numbers, then the Ancient Star Rod may not be used to defend against a weapon at all.

Placing this card under the Holographic Bunny turns it into a live bunny, capable of winning the game, but vulnerable to weapons, Feed The Bunny cards or dangerous circumstances. This action may be performed after the last Carrot has been taken from Kaballa's Market but before the Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to eliminate either the Nuclear Warhead, Cruise Missile Prime, H.E.M.P., F-18 Hornet, or Blue Angels. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Protects any one player's bunnies from alien abduction for the duration of the game. Or may be used once to retrieve bunnies safely. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
Bunnies In Black protects any one player's bunnies from alien abductions by the Beyea Aliens (Area 51) or their Mothership for the duration of the game providing that this card is a saved Very Special.

Or Bunnies In Black may be used once by a player to retrieve bunnies safely from the Beyea Aliens. Bunnies retrieved become the property of the player and must immediately be placed in The Bunny Circle. A player must discard the Bunnies In Black card after retrieving bunnies from the Beyea Aliens.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to change the direction of play (clockwise or counter-clockwise) allowing one player to take consecutive turns. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: One of your bunnies pulls the pin of a grenade thinking it would make absolutely fabulous jewelry!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If a player draws a PLAY IMMEDIATELY card but has no bunny in The Bunny Circle, then he must place the card on an opponent's bunny in The Bunny Circle causing it to die (discarded). This is also true if the player's only bunny in The Bunny Circle is protected by The Heavenly Halo or Angel Wings

rules.title: Protection
rules.text: The Heavenly Halo and Angel Wings will protect a bunny from any terrible misfortune. The Guardian Angle can be used to eliminate a Terrible Misfortune.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: One of your bunnies enthusiastically goes white water rafting but just a bit too far down stream!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If a player draws a PLAY IMMEDIATELY card but has no bunny in The Bunny Circle, then he must place the card on an opponent's bunny in The Bunny Circle causing it to die (discarded). This is also true if the player's only bunny in The Bunny Circle is protected by The Heavenly Halo or Angel Wings

rules.title: Protection
rules.text: The Heavenly Halo and Angel Wings will protect a bunny from any terrible misfortune. The Guardian Angle can be used to eliminate a Terrible Misfortune.
